faq-wasp-P8qD2hsM.q: How does Wasp’s Static Barrier work?
faq-wasp-P8qD2hsM.a:
Static Barrier divides the map into 2 regions: spaces within its radius and outside its radius. Enemy units cannot **move** or **fast travel** across the “barrier” between the two regions:
- ❌They cannot take a move action (to move or fast travel) to move across the barrier.
- ❌They cannot use an attack or skill involving movement to cross the barrier.
- ❌They cannot cross the barrier on their path, even if they cross back. That is, a hero outside the barrier cannot walk into the radius and then walk back out.
- ✅They can use a “place” or “swap” effect (such as Arien’s Alt Blue) to cross the barrier.
- ✅They can be pushed across the barrier (pushing is not movement) or moved by another player’s card.

faq-wasp-iOUfdU2P.q: How does Wasp’s ability move units and tokens?
faq-wasp-iOUfdU2P.a: The target cannot move farther away or closer, so the distance between you and the target must remain unchanged.

faq-wasp-6LS6R1fC.q: When does Wasp’s  push ability force a discard?
faq-wasp-6LS6R1fC.a: This card pushes adjacent enemies away from you (in a straight line). If an enemy Hero cannot be pushed the full distance, because an obstacle is located along the straight line path, the Hero is forced to discard.

faq-wasp-uCXB6YGe.q: Why do Wasp’s Tier II and III abilities say “If you do”? Why would the block fail?
faq-wasp-uCXB6YGe.a: You can always discard a card to attempt to defend, even if it does not defend successfully.

faq-wasp-jjFB6hGs.q: Can enemies from further away use their placement abilities to approach Wasp?
faq-wasp-jjFB6hGs.a: Yes, the ability does **not** prevent enemey heroes from placing or swapping themselfs (or their friends) into the radius of Wasp’s dagger.
